      public java.lang.String getProgramName()
      Returns:
      program name

    • setProgramName

      public HelpUsage setProgramName​(java.lang.String programName)
      Sets the program name. If the given String is null, "null" will be used.
      Parameters:
      programName - program name
      Returns:
      this HelpUsage

    • addTargets

      public HelpUsage addTargets​(java.lang.String... targets)
      Adds simple targets without callbacks to this usage to display. These should be sorted for cohesion.
      Parameters:
      targets - targets (files, inputs, etc.)
      Returns:
      this HelpUsage

    • addTargets

      public HelpUsage addTargets​(HelpTarget... targets)
      Adds targets to this usage to display. These should be sorted.
      Parameters:
      targets - targets (files, inputs, etc.)
      Returns:
      this HelpUsage
      See Also:
      getTarget(int), hasNextTarget(), getNextTarget()

    • getTargets

      public HelpTarget[] getTargets()
      Returns:
      help targets

    • hasNextTarget

      public boolean hasNextTarget()
      Returns whether there exists a next target using the built-in index.
      Returns:
      true if next target exists. false if not.
      See Also:
      getNextTarget(), resetNextTarget()

    • getNextTarget

      public HelpTarget getNextTarget() throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the next target and increases the built-int index.
      Returns:
      next target
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if built-in index is out of range
      See Also:
      hasNextTarget(), resetNextTarget()

    • getTarget

      public HelpTarget getTarget​(int index) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the target at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      index - index of target
      Returns:
      target at the specified position
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= numberOfTargets())

    • numberOfTargets

      public int numberOfTargets()
      Returns the number of targets.
      Returns:
      number of targets

    • resetNextTarget

      public HelpUsage resetNextTarget()
      Resets the built-int index for getNextTarget().
      Returns:
      this HelpUsage

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns this HelpUsage as a beautified String to print.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      printable representation
